newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lankan rupee ends firmer on high money rates.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lankan rupee ends firmer on high money rates.

text.p: The Sri Lankan rupee closed firmer against the dollar on Tuesday despite speculation that the Central Bank would allow further falls of the local currency, dealers said.
The rupee ended at 56.12 after opening at 56.28 and fluctuating during the day.
"The demand for dollars was there, but demand for rupees was higher," a Hatton National Bank dealer said.
The overnight call money rate closed the day at 16 percent after reaching 17 percent during the day, dealers said. It closed at 15.5 percent on Monday.
Dealers said the local currency, which fell to a record low of 56.40 to the dollar on Monday, was expected to fall further.
"The pattern shows the Central Bank is devaluating it by 30 to 40 cents on a monthly basis," the Hatton Natonal dealer said.
The Central Bank pushed up the rupee by half a local cent on Tuesday, setting dollar buying and selling rates at 55.6677 and 56.7923.
"Depending on the money situation tomorrow -- we should see it around 18-19 percent -- the dollar would decline further," a local dealer said. -- Mohan Samarasinghe (941) 434319
